thread.title: Rangers hitting, bullpen coaches gone; rest of Banister staff invited back
thread.title_full: Rangers hitting, bullpen coaches gone; rest of Banister staff invited back

title: Rangers hitting, bullpen coaches gone; rest of Banister staff invited back
text:
Rangers hitting, bullpen coaches gone; rest of Banister staff invited back 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Friday, October 16, 2015 04:04 PM EDT | Updated: Friday, October 16, 2015 04:20 PM EDT Ryan Rua of the Texas Rangers high fives batting coach Dave Magadan. (Victor Decolongon/AFP) Blue Jays' Jose Bautista 'caught ... ridin' dirty' 
ARLINGTON, Texas -- Texas Rangers hitting coach Dave Magadan and bullpen coach Andy Hawkins are not returning next season. 
The Rangers said Friday that it was a mutual decision between the team and Magadan, who would like to seek opportunities closer to his home in Florida. He just finished his third season in Texas. 
Hawkins informed the team that he is resigning to pursue opportunities with other teams. He was the longest-tenured coach on the major league staff, having been with Texas since Aug. 1, 2008. 
The six other members of manager Jeff Banister's coaching staff have been invited to return in 2016. They are third base coach Tony Beasley, bench coach Steve Buechele, assistant hitting coach Bobby Jones, pitching coach Mike Maddux, first base coach Hector Ortiz, and field co-ordinator Jayce Tingler. Rangers invite 6 members of major league coaching staff to return for 2016. Andy Hawkins and Dave Magadan will not return. â€” John Blake (@RangerBlake) October 16, 2015 Sponsored Links
